event_registry_properties.name: action
event_registry_properties.item: Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.
event_registry_properties.name: description
event_registry_properties.item: The XB chip has detected it does not have sufficient power to continue operating.
event_registry_properties.name: details
event_registry_properties.item:
The platform has detected an XB chip does not have sufficient power to continue operating.


   SPARC Enterprise M8000 platform:

      If the precise XB chip can be identified,
      then the entire platform is reset and a crossbar way will be deconfigured.
      
         If this is the first crossbar way being deconfigured,
         then the platform will operate with reduced performance.

         If a crossbar way has already been deconfigured,
         then the platform will be powered down.

         BP_A backplane will appear on the suspect list for the fault.

      
      If the precise XB chip cannot be identified from this fault,
      then the platform will be reset and nothing is deconfigured due to this fault.

         Another fault that deconfigures resources will likely occur at
         approximately the same time as this fault.




   SPARC Enterprise M9000 platform:

      If the precise XB chip can be identified,
      then the entire platform is reset and a crossbar way will be deconfigured.
      
         If this is the first crossbar way being deconfigured,
         then the platform will operate with reduced performance.

         If a crossbar way has already been deconfigured,
         then the platform will be powered down.

         XBU will appear on the suspect list for the fault.



      If the precise XB chip cannot be identified from this fault,
      then the platform will be reset and nothing is deconfigured due to this fault.

         Another fault that deconfigures resources will likely occur at
         approximately the same time as this fault.



The recommended service action for this event is to schedule the replacement of the affected FRU's.

       LEGEND

      RED        = SUNW-MSG-ID
      BLUE     = EVENT_ID
      GREEN  = FRU


Step 1. Collect the fault message (use one of the following methods):


   Single-line fault message displayed on the XSCF console:

   Mar 27 15:13:51 nwk-dc2-1-sc0 fmd: SOURCE: sde, REV: 1.12, CSN: nwk-dc2-1  
   EVENT-ID: d3e28c7d-4efb-447a-b74d-fa461783040d
   Refer to %FMAURL%/SCF-8004-5S for detailed information.


   Complete fault message using 'fmdump -m' on the XSCF console:

   MSG-ID: SCF-8004-5S, TYPE: Fault, VER: 1, SEVERITY: Critical
   EVENT-TIME: Tue Mar 27 15:13:51 PDT 2007
   PLATFORM: SPARC-Enterprise, CSN: nwk-dc2-1, HOSTNAME: nwk-dc2-1-sc0
   SOURCE: sde, REV: 1.12
   EVENT-ID: d3e28c7d-4efb-447a-b74d-fa461783040d
   DESC: The XB chip has detected it does not have sufficient power to continue operating.
   Refer to %FMAURL%/SCF-8004-5S for more information.
   AUTO-RESPONSE: Resources may be deconfigured after a platform reset.
   Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.
   IMPACT: The platform will be reset.
   REC-ACTION: Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.


Step 2. Collect the output from the 'fmdump -v -u EVENT_ID' command


        xscf> fmdump -v -u d3e28c7d-4efb-447a-b74d-fa461783040d

        TIME                 UUID                                 MSG-ID
        Mar 27 15:13:51.3961 d3e28c7d-4efb-447a-b74d-fa461783040d SCF-8004-5S
          100%  fault.chassis.SPARC-Enterprise.asic.xb.power.fail

                Problem in: hc:///chassis=0
                   Affects: -
                       FRU: hc://:product-id=SPARC-Enterprise:chassis-id=nwk-dc2-1:
                            server-id=nwk-dc2-1-sc0/component=CHASSIS




Step 3. Contact your Authorized Service Provider.



If you require additional information, please refer to InfoDoc #87402.
event_registry_properties.name: impact
response
event_registry_properties.item: Resources may be deconfigured after a platform reset. Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.
event_registry_properties.name: title
event_registry_properties.item: XB chip detected a power failure.
